paragraphs.body: Hey, I’m Nazmuz (Shakib) Pranto, a frontend engineer with over 5 years of hands-on experience building dynamic, high-performance web applications and reusable design systems. I’m passionate about creating clean, responsive, and accessible user interfaces using modern technologies like TypeScript, React, Next.js, and Node.js. I love contributing to meaningful products that deliver immediate value to customers while continuously learning and improving.

Throughout my career, I’ve had the privilege of working on impactful projects across different companies. At Best Buy, I enhanced critical e-commerce pages visited by millions daily, ensuring seamless customer experiences through performance optimization and tooling improvements. Before that, at Newfold Digital, I contributed to a highly customizable e-commerce platform that streamlined workflows and feature delivery across multiple internal teams. Along the way, I’ve also built utility libraries and tools to simplify development processes for internal and external use.

My web development journey began in my first year of college while studying Computer Science. Learning HTML and CSS through Codeacademy felt more engaging and practical than my coursework, which inspired me to dive deeper. That curiosity led me to take a bold step—taking time off from college to enroll in an immersive software engineering program at DevMountain, where I gained hands-on experience solving real-world challenges.

I always believed that I was a go-getter who loves taking risks to improve and get better progressively. That's why I pursued an alternative track to higher education. While I understand the importance of traditional computer science education with a heavy theoretical learning approach, I don't think it's enough for diving into real-world problems in the most effective way. We need more practical, project-based learning, where learning to code is acquired from a series of trials and mistakes. As an student at DevMountain, I have learned to do exactly that and have taken that lesson to heart till today.

I’ve always embraced a growth mindset and a willingness to take calculated risks. My alternative path to education taught me the value of learning through trial, error, and collaboration. Since then, I’ve been fortunate to work in diverse roles, starting with Lexia Learning, where I focused on scripting and automation, to Newfold Digital, where I grew into a full-time software engineering role. Now, at Best Buy, I’m working on large-scale applications that impact millions of customers daily.

I’m far from the finish line and remain dedicated to improving a little every day. In my next steps, I aim to contribute my expertise to impactful projects while learning modern techniques and best practices from my mentors and developers of all levels. My goal is to evolve into a well-rounded senior engineer / architect and eventually mentor others in their journeys.
